muchart 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    Generate random samples from the gamma distribution

    r_g.Rd

    This function generates random samples from the gamma distribution.

    Usage

    r_g(lots, n, mu, k, ...)

    Arguments

    lots

    The number of lots

    n

    The sample size

    mu

    The mean of the gamma distribution

    k

    The shape parameter of the gamma distribution

    ...

    Additional arguments to be passed to rgamma() from the stats package

    Value

    A matrix of random samples

    Examples

    r_g(lots = 5, n = 10, mu = 5, k = 2)
#>               n_1       n_2        n_3       n_4       n_5       n_6      n_7
#> sample_1 1.725470 4.4574017  6.2017774 1.5437052 1.6653992  4.865615 6.683492
#> sample_2 5.050448 0.8938192 10.2534896 0.6648468 3.2103797  3.575766 2.374901
#> sample_3 2.848012 4.9053713  6.1249483 1.9877419 0.1185224 19.151395 2.893475
#> sample_4 5.977826 1.1037327  4.2893852 2.2904598 8.0834793 12.451041 8.774419
#> sample_5 3.341927 5.2561223  0.3165478 1.9675820 9.0765358  8.844037 8.200472
#>               n_8       n_9     n_10
#> sample_1 6.970045 1.5419157 4.308112
#> sample_2 6.368091 1.1067823 3.891339
#> sample_3 5.878615 1.8861282 2.912157
#> sample_4 1.580403 2.7300554 5.117952
#> sample_5 1.666422 0.2584064 2.335495
r_g(lots = 10, n = 20, mu = 10, k = 3)
